abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Stabilization
            of Electricity Supply in the Republic of Montenegro Project
            for Yugoslavia were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory,
            the risk to development outcome was low or negligible, the
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            Application of modern metering technology provides utilities
            suffering from high network losses and poor collections with
            a means of mitigating these problems. However for any
            metering project to be effective, it will be accompanied
            with an investment program of rehabilitation of Latvia (LV)
            networks and feeders where the metering project is
            implemented. Given the associated cost of modern metering
            and network rehabilitation, utilities are advised to
            gradually expand new metering technology in areas that will
            yield the highest benefits as determined by a cost/benefit
            analysis performed for the metering project. To avoid delays
            in project implementation, adequate time and effort is
            required to develop a suitable design for a proper metering
            system, tender packages, the bid evaluation process, and to
            develop a realistic plan for project implementation.
            Significant costs will be associated with the initial stage
            of an automatic meter reading (AMR) System project. However,
            costs of subsequent scale up stages of the AMR system may be
            lower due to increased implementation efficiency by utility
            staff and the economies of scale.
